description: Catalog of WildFly 37.0.0.Beta1-SNAPSHOT features (incomplete for now) to provision a WildFly server

legend.layer: The Galleon layer name to use to provision the feature.
legend.description: The textual description of the layer.
legend.stability: One of default, community, preview and experimental. community and default stability features are available by default.
legend.note: To highlight a particularity that occurs when provisioning this layer.
legend.glowDiscoverable: WildFly Glow (CLI or support in the WildFly Maven Plugin), can discover the layer from the API used in your deployment. If false, it must be added using the WildFly Glow addOn name.
legend.glowAddOn: The name of the WildFly Glow addOn to use to provision this functionality when using Wildfly Glow.
legend.glowRules: The list of rules that WildFly Glow uses to discover that your deployment requires this layer (API in use, expected XML descriptor, ...).
legend.feature-pack: The Galleon feature-pack that defines the layer.
legend.managementModel: The part of the management model this layer brings to the server configuration. Can be empty if this layer only aggregates some layers.
legend.dependencies: The list of layers this layer depends on. Those layers are also provisioned when this layer is provisioned.

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.annotated.type
glowRules.ruleDescription: Expected annotated type, annotation and annotation field values. Field values can be regex. This rule can take a suffix and be used multiple times for a given layer.

Value is either an IP address in IPv6 or IPv4 dotted decimal notation, or a hostname that can be resolved to an IP address. An 'undefined' value means this attribute is not relevant to the IP address selection.

children.description: Contains a list of socket configurations.
Configuration information for a socket.

attributes.name: interface
attributes.description: Name of the interface to which the socket should be bound, or, for multicast sockets, the interface on which it should listen. This should be one of the declared interfaces.

attributes.name: multicast-address
attributes.description: Multicast address on which the socket should receive multicast traffic. If unspecified, the socket will not be configured to receive multicast.

attributes.name: multicast-port
attributes.description: Port on which the socket should receive multicast traffic. Must be configured if 'multicast-address' is configured.

attributes.name: aliases

attributes.description: The default infinispan cache

attributes.name: marshaller
attributes.description: Defines the marshalling implementation used to marshal cache entries.

attributes.description: The set of modules associated with this cache container's configuration.

children.description: A distributed cache configuration.
The cache expiration configuration.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: Interval (in milliseconds) between subsequent runs to purge expired entries from memory and any cache stores. If you wish to disable the periodic eviction process altogether, set wakeupInterval to -1.

children.description: The locking configuration of the cache.

attributes.name: isolation
attributes.description: Sets the cache locking isolation level.

children.description: The cache transaction configuration.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: Sets the cache transaction mode to one of NONE, NON_XA, NON_DURABLE_XA, FULL_XA.

children.description: The cache file store configuration.

attributes.name: passivation
attributes.description: If true, data is only written to the cache store when it is evicted from memory, a phenomenon known as 'passivation'. Next time the data is requested, it will be 'activated' which means that data will be brought back to memory and removed from the persistent store. If false, the cache store contains a copy of the contents in memory, so writes to cache result in cache store writes. This essentially gives you a 'write-through' configuration.

attributes.name: purge
attributes.description: If true, purges this cache store when it starts up.

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.profile-ha
glowRules.ruleDescription: References the counter part layer for the given profile. The rule name must be suffixed with the profile name. Known profile is 'ha'.
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: Inside `singleton-ha` layer, this rule references the `org.wildfly.rule.profile-ha=singleton-local`. It means that when `singleton-local` is discovered and ha profile is enabled, `singleton-ha` is included.

children.description: The configuration of the Jakarta Persistence subsystem.

attributes.name: default-extended-persistence-inheritance
attributes.description: Controls how Jakarta Persistence extended persistence context (XPC) inheritance is performed. 'DEEP' shares the extended persistence context at top bean level.  'SHALLOW' the extended persistece context is only shared with the parent bean (never with sibling beans).

functionalities.description: Support for JPA with a distributed second level cache.
functionalities.note: jpa layer must be explicitly excluded if jpa-distributed is in use.

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.profile-ha
glowRules.ruleDescription: References the counter part layer for the given profile. The rule name must be suffixed with the profile name. Known profile is 'ha'.
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: Inside `singleton-ha` layer, this rule references the `org.wildfly.rule.profile-ha=singleton-local`. It means that when `singleton-local` is discovered and ha profile is enabled, `singleton-ha` is included.

children.description: A JDBC data-source configuration
A JDBC data-source configuration

attributes.name: background-validation
attributes.description: An element to specify that connections should be validated on a background thread versus being validated prior to use. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource,  requires a server restart otherwise.

attributes.name: background-validation-millis
attributes.description: The background-validation-millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that background validation will run. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource,  requires a server restart otherwise

attributes.name: connection-url
attributes.description: The JDBC driver connection URL

attributes.name: driver-name
attributes.description: Defines the JDBC driver the datasource should use. It is a symbolic name matching the the name of installed driver. In case the driver is deployed as a jar, the name is the name of the deployment unit

attributes.name: enabled
attributes.description: Specifies if the datasource should be enabled. Note this attribute will not be supported runtime in next versions.

attributes.name: exception-sorter-class-name
attributes.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ExceptionSorter that provides an isExceptionFatal(SQLException) method to validate if an exception should broadcast an error

attributes.name: flush-strategy
attributes.description: Specifies how the pool should be flush in case of an error.

attributes.name: idle-timeout-minutes
attributes.description: The idle-timeout-minutes elements specifies the maximum time, in minutes, a connection may be idle before being closed. The actual maximum time depends also on the IdleRemover scan time, which is half of the smallest idle-timeout-minutes value of any pool. Changing this value can be done only on disabled datasource, requires a server restart otherwise.

attributes.name: jndi-name
attributes.description: Specifies the JNDI name for the datasource

attributes.name: jta
attributes.description: Enable Jakarta Transactions integration

attributes.name: max-pool-size
attributes.description: The max-pool-size element specifies the maximum number of connections for a pool. No more connections will be created in each sub-pool

attributes.name: min-pool-size
attributes.description: The min-pool-size element specifies the minimum number of connections for a pool

attributes.name: password
attributes.description: Specifies the password used when creating a new connection

attributes.name: stale-connection-checker-class-name
attributes.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.StaleConnectionChecker that provides an isStaleConnection(SQLException) method which if it returns true will wrap the exception in an org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.StaleConnectionException

attributes.name: statistics-enabled
attributes.description: Define whether runtime statistics are enabled or not.

attributes.name: transaction-isolation
attributes.description: Set the java.sql.Connection transaction isolation level. Valid values are: TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED, TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED, TRANSACTION_REPEATABLE_READ, TRANSACTION_SERIALIZABLE and TRANSACTION_NONE. Different values are used to set customLevel using TransactionIsolation#customLevel

attributes.name: user-name
attributes.description: Specify the user name used when creating a new connection

attributes.name: valid-connection-checker-class-name
attributes.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ValidConnectionChecker that provides an isValidConnection(Connection) method to validate a connection. If an exception is returned that means the connection is invalid. This overrides the check-valid-connection-sql element

attributes.name: validate-on-match
attributes.description: The validate-on-match element specifies if connection validation should be done when a connection factory attempts to match a managed connection. This is typically exclusive to the use of background validation

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.configuration
glowRules.ruleDescription: The URL where to find yaml file containing the configuration (env variables to configure the layer).
glowRules.valueDescription: e.g.: `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jfdenise/wildfly-datasources-galleon-pack/layers_metadata/doc/mariadb/env.yaml`

glowRules.ruleDescription: Lookup of XML path inside a set of files. If multiple rules exist, the rule name can be extended with a suffix `<rule name>-<suffix>`
glowRules.valueDescription: Array of files followed by expected path and value. e.g.: `[/WEB-INF/.xml,/META-INF/.xml],/datasources/datasource/driver,h2`

glowRules.name: org.wildfly.rule.annotation.field.value-url
glowRules.ruleDescription: Expected annotation with field values. Field values can be regex. This rule can be added multiple time to a layer, it must contains a suffix to be unique.
glowRules.valueDescription: The annotation with a field value. For example: `jakarta.annotation.sql.DataSourceDefinition,className=org.h2.*`

attributes.name: derive-size
attributes.description: Specifies if and what the max pool size should be derived from. An undefined value (or the deprecated value 'none' which is converted to undefined) indicates that the explicit value of max-pool-size should be used. A value of 'from-worker-pools' indicates that the max pool size should be derived from the size of the total threads for all worker pools configured on the system. A value of 'from-cpu-count' indicates that the max pool size should be derived from the total number of processors available on the system. Note that the computation isn't a 1:1 mapping, the values may or may not be augmented by other factors.

attributes.name: interval
attributes.description: Interval (in milliseconds) between subsequent runs to purge expired entries from memory and any cache stores. If you wish to disable the periodic eviction process altogether, set wakeupInterval to -1.

children.description: The cache file store configuration.

attributes.name: passivation
attributes.description: If true, data is only written to the cache store when it is evicted from memory, a phenomenon known as 'passivation'. Next time the data is requested, it will be 'activated' which means that data will be brought back to memory and removed from the persistent store. If false, the cache store contains a copy of the contents in memory, so writes to cache result in cache store writes. This essentially gives you a 'write-through' configuration.

children.description: A local cache configuration

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: Sets the cache transaction mode to one of NONE, NON_XA, NON_DURABLE_XA, FULL_XA.

children.description: The cache file store configuration.

attributes.name: preload
attributes.description: If true, when the cache starts, data stored in the cache store will be pre-loaded into memory. This is particularly useful when data in the cache store will be needed immediately after startup and you want to avoid cache operations being delayed as a result of loading this data lazily. Can be used to provide a 'warm-cache' on startup, however there is a performance penalty as startup time is affected by this process.

attributes.name: passivation
attributes.description: If true, data is only written to the cache store when it is evicted from memory, a phenomenon known as 'passivation'. Next time the data is requested, it will be 'activated' which means that data will be brought back to memory and removed from the persistent store. If false, the cache store contains a copy of the contents in memory, so writes to cache result in cache store writes. This essentially gives you a 'write-through' configuration.

attributes.name: purge
attributes.description: If true, purges this cache store when it starts up.

children.description: A thread pool executor with a bounded queue where threads submittings tasks may block. Such a thread pool has a core and maximum size and a specified queue length.  When a task is submitted, if the number of running threads is less than the core size, a new thread is created.  Otherwise, if there is room in the queue, the task is enqueued. Otherwise, if the number of running threads is less than the maximum size, a new thread is created. Otherwise, the caller blocks until room becomes available in the queue.

attributes.name: core-threads
attributes.description: The core thread pool size which is smaller than the maximum pool size. If undefined, the core thread pool size is the same as the maximum thread pool size.

attributes.name: max-threads
attributes.description: The maximum thread pool size.

attributes.name: queue-length
attributes.description: The queue length.
